items.title: Families frayed by NDIS cuts brace for more change ahead of defining year
items.description: Families frayed by NDIS cuts are bracing for even more change ahead of a year that's set to reshape the scheme into something more sustainable, write Nas Campanella and Evan Young.

items.title: Charge laid after allegedly stolen car crashes into Geelong school bus
items.description: A 43-year-old woman has been charged with handling stolen goods after a dramatic incident that saw police open fire at a vehicle that allegedly drove at officers after crashing into a bus on Thursday afternoon.

items.title: Live: Four people dead after 'devastating tragedy' in Perth's Mosman Park
items.description: WA Police are investigating a suspected murder-suicide in suburban Perth after finding two teenage boys and two adults dead in a home in Mosman Park.

items.title: Last-ditch deal sees government give states extra $25b in hospital funding
items.description: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has bowed to mounting pressure from the states, promising $25 billion for public hospitals.

items.title: Venezuela approves law ending 20 years of state oil control

featured_image.name: World Leaders Address United Nations General Assembly

items.description:
Venezuela's National Assembly on Thursday approved a sweeping reform to the country's hydrocarbons law, ending more than two decades of state control over the nation's oil sector and opening the door to private investment in the world's largest proven crude reserves.[1][2][3]

The vote marks a dramatic departure from the socialist economic model that has governed Venezuela since former President Hugo Chávez nationalized the industry in the mid-2000s. The legislation comes less than a month after the U.S. military captured then-President Nicolás Maduro in Caracas on January 3.[4][1]

items.title: 'Traditional media is dying': Nine sells radio stations for $56m
items.description: Arthur Laundy's Laundy Family Office acquires a network that includes Melbourne's top-rating talk station 3AW, Sydney's 2GB and outspoken conservative presenters such as Ben Fordham and Tom Elliott.

items.title: Ley issues ultimatum on Coalition reunion with temporary frontbench
items.description: The under-fire Liberal leader has given seven existing frontbenchers carriage of the portfolios vacated by Nationals, with a threat to leader David Littleproud the arrangements could be made permanent.

items.title: Australia taking Nipah virus seriously but no changes to border control
items.description: The federal government is closely monitoring an outbreak of Nipah virus in India but has not received any advice to tighten border controls at this stage.

items.title: Live: Alcaraz, Zverev in tight start on RLA after Aussies take mixed doubles crown
items.description: Carlos Alcaraz and Alexander Zverev start their much-anticipated men's singles semifinal on day 13, as Australia's Olivia Gadecki and John Peers claim their second straight mixed doubles title. Follow live.

items.title: The US looks poised to strike Iran — but what is Trump's endgame?
items.description: As the "massive armada" of the United States approaches Iran to be in place for a possible military attack, a key question remains: what can such firepower actually achieve?

items.title: The armed groups that may risk the US 'recovery' plan to control Venezuela
items.description: The US plan to "recover" Venezuela could spark a domestic backlash in a country that is already heavily divided among various armed groups that have political interests.

items.title: Gold surges to record high near $5,600 for ninth straight session

featured_image.name: Gold Just Hit a Record $5,600, What's Driving the Surge?

items.description: World stocks gained on Thursday as investors maintained their appetite for equities ahead of Apple results, while gold climbed to a record high for the ninth consecutive session. The rally in precious metals, coupled with strong corporate guidance from Meta, provided support across global markets despite concerns over tech sector capital expenditure.

items.title: Amazon in talks to invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI

featured_image.name: Amazon could invest up to $50 billion in OpenAI in coming weeks, source says

items.description:
Amazon.com, Inc. is negotiating a potential investment of up to $50 billion in OpenAI, according to a report from The Wall Street Journal on Thursday, a deal that would represent one of the largest bets yet on artificial intelligence and deepen ties between the world's largest cloud-computing provider and the maker of ChatGPT.

Amazon CEO Andy Jassy is personally leading the discussions with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman, sources familiar with the matter told The Wall Street Journal and CNBC. The final structure of any potential deal remains fluid, though a term sheet could be finalized in the coming weeks, according to CNBC.[1][2][3]

items.title: Apple posts record quarter as iPhone sales surge 23%

featured_image.name: Apple Revenue Pops 16% to Nearly $144 Billion in Year-End 2025 ...

items.description:
Apple delivered what CEO Tim Cook called a "remarkable, record-breaking quarter" on Thursday, posting fiscal first-quarter results that far exceeded Wall Street expectations as iPhone sales surged 23% year-over-year to drive the company's best holiday period ever.

The tech giant reported revenue of $143.8 billion for the quarter ending December 27, up 16% from the prior year and well ahead of analyst estimates of $138.4 billion. Earnings per share reached $2.84, a 19% increase that set a new all-time record and topped the $2.67 consensus forecast.[1][2][3]

items.title: Nvidia, Microsoft and Amazon in talks to invest $60B in OpenAI

featured_image.name: OpenAI seek investments from Middle East for multibillion-dollar round

items.description:
Nvidia, Microsoft and Amazon are in discussions to invest up to $60 billion in OpenAI, according to a report by The Information published Wednesday. The talks, if they lead to a deal, would be one of the largest private financings ever for an AI company and would further entangle the world’s biggest technology suppliers in the scramble for computing power and market share in generative AI.[1][2][3]

The negotiations are ongoing and terms could change, and Reuters said it could not immediately verify The Information’s reporting. Still, the report fits a widening fundraising push around OpenAI that has drawn in major strategic backers and deep pools of global capital.[3][1]

items.title: Cuba's oil reserves down to 15-20 days as U.S. pressure mounts

featured_image.name: Cuba runs short on fuel at pump as energy crisis festers ...

items.description:
Cuba's oil reserves have dwindled to a level that will sustain the island for only 15 to 20 days, according to data from energy analytics firm Kpler, as U.S. pressure on traditional suppliers threatens to push the nation toward economic collapse.

The crisis has deepened rapidly following the Trump administration's January 3 military operation that captured Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro, effectively severing Cuba's primary oil lifeline. Venezuela, which supplied roughly a third of Cuba's oil at approximately 26,500 barrels per day in 2025, has not shipped any crude or fuel to the Caribbean island since early January.[1][2][3]

items.title: SpaceX and xAI in merger talks ahead of potential record IPO

featured_image.name: A SpaceX IPO could be the largest public offering of all ...

items.description:
Elon Musk's SpaceX and xAI are in negotiations regarding a potential merger ahead of what could become the largest initial public offering in history, according to exclusive reporting by Reuters.[1][2][3]

The merger would unite Musk's aerospace empire with his artificial intelligence venture, consolidating the Starlink satellite network, the X social media platform, and the Grok AI chatbot under a single corporate structure. Reuters reported that two Nevada entities were established on January 21 to facilitate the transaction, with SpaceX Chief Financial Officer Bret Johnsen listed as a managing member in corporate filings.[2][1]

items.title: Rubio says Donetsk is final obstacle in Ukraine peace talks

featured_image.name: Rubio says work under way to resolve 'very difficult' Donetsk issue in Ukraine peace talks

items.description:
Territorial disputes over Donetsk have emerged as the final barrier to ending the nearly four-year war in Ukraine, US Secretary of State Marco Rubio said Wednesday, as trilateral negotiations between Washington, Kyiv, and Moscow prepare to resume this weekend amid concerns about the preparedness of American negotiators.

"The one remaining item … is the territorial claim on Donetsk. There is active work going to try to see if both sides' views on this can be reconciled," Rubio told a US Senate Foreign Relations Committee hearing on January 28. "It's still a bridge we haven't crossed. It's still a gap, but at least we've been able to narrow down the issue set to one central one, and it will probably be a very difficult one."[1][2]

Russia currently occupies roughly 70 percent of Donetsk and demands Ukraine cede the remaining territory it controls. Kyiv has refused to surrender land that Russian forces have not captured on the battlefield, with polls showing little Ukrainian public support for territorial concessions.[3][4]

items.title: Gold hits record high, oil surges as Trump threatens Iran strike

featured_image.name: Gold is on a tear so far in 2026, hitting new trading highs

items.description:
Gold surged past $5,500 per ounce for the first time Thursday, while oil prices climbed to multi-month highs as President Donald Trump escalated military threats against Iran over its nuclear program. The precious metal touched an intraday record of $5,608 before pulling back sharply amid volatile trading, while Brent crude topped $70 a barrel for the first time since late summer.

The commodity rallies came as Trump warned Iran that "time is running out" to negotiate a nuclear deal, posting on Truth Social that a "massive armada" was heading toward the region "with speed and violence, if necessary."[1][2]

items.title: SpaceX and xAI in merger talks ahead of potential IPO, Reuters reports

featured_image.name: Musk's SpaceX in merger talks with xAI ahead of planned IPO, source says

items.description:
Elon Musk’s SpaceX and his artificial-intelligence company xAI are in talks to merge ahead of a planned public offering, a move that would combine rockets, satellites, social media and AI products inside one corporate structure, according to a Reuters report citing a person briefed on the matter and corporate filings.[1][2]

The discussions, first reported by Reuters, would bring SpaceX’s launch business and Starlink satellite network together with xAI’s Grok chatbot and the X social-media platform, which xAI controls. Under the proposed structure, xAI shares would be exchanged for SpaceX shares, the source said, with some xAI executives potentially offered cash instead of SpaceX stock. No final agreement has been signed, and the timing and structure remain fluid, Reuters reported.[2][1]

items.title: President Trump Announces U.S. Military Airstrike in Venezuela
items.description: President Trump states the U.S. military conducted its first known airstrike inside Venezuela targeting a dock where drugs were allegedly loaded onto boats[1][2][4].

items.title: Trump Meets Netanyahu at Mar-a-Lago for Gaza Ceasefire Phase Two Talks
items.description: President Trump met with Israeli Prime Minister Netanyahu to discuss advancing phase two of the Gaza ceasefire, including reconstruction and responses to Iran[1][4].

items.title: Feds Launch Massive Taxpayer Fraud Probe in Minnesota After Viral Video
items.description: Federal agencies including DHS, FBI, and ICE investigate $110 million in suspected fraud at Minnesota child care centers following a viral YouTube video[3].

items.title: Americans Express Widespread Opposition to AI Data Centers
items.description: Public backlash against AI infrastructure data centers grows, with protests and demands for bans influencing Democratic Party strategies for future elections[3].

items.title: Elon Musk's Humanoid Robot Vision: China Poised to Lead Production
items.description: China prioritizes humanoid robots in tech race with U.S., ramping up production while warning of industry bubble and potential bottlenecks[3].

items.title: Trump-Putin Call Amid Ukraine-Russia Tensions Over Peace Plan
items.description: President Trump spoke with Putin amid ongoing Ukraine conflict, with Russia reevaluating peace plan tenets after Ukrainian denials[1].

items.title: Democratic Gubernatorial Candidates in Wisconsin Focus on Inflation and Trump
items.description: Seven Democrats vying for Wisconsin governor blame economic issues on Trump and emphasize affordability ahead of 2026 primary[3].
